name: alphorn
description: The alphorn, or alpine horn, is a conical wood horn used for communication in mountains.

name: clarinet
description: The clarinet is a clarinet in E♭ or sometimes F, normally with a curved neck.

name: flute
description: The flute is a concert flute in G, lower in tone than the flûte d'amour.

name: saxophone
description: The saxophone is a woodwind invented by Adolphe Sax which is between the tenor and soprano in size.

name: horn
description: The horn is a piston valve brass instrument with a wide-rimmed cup mouthpiece which is pitched in B♭, one octave below the B♭ trumpet.

name: trumpet
description: The natural trumpet used in the 1500s to 1700s, this mid 20th century reinvention lacks valves but may have vents.

name: barrel organ
description: A barrel organ is a mechanical musical instrument typically operated by a person turning a crank which turns a barrel which has music encoded onto it.

name: oboe
description: The bass oboe is a double reed woodwind instrument which is about twice the size of a regular oboe.

name: bazooka
description: The bazooka is a brass musical instrument several feet in length which incorporates telescopic tubing.

name: harmonica (mouth organ)
description: Used especially in blues, American folk and country.

name: 17-string bass koto
description: A koto with 17 rather than 13 strings, sometimes described as a bass koto.

name: acoustic fretless guitar
description: Acoustic guitar without frets.

name: archtop guitar
description: An archtop guitar is a steel-stringed acoustic or semi-acoustic guitar with a distinctive arched top, which is particularly popular with jazz players.

name: banjo-ukulele
description: small fretted hybrid instrument with a banjo body and a ukulele neck, popular in the 1920-30.

name: bass guitar
description: Bass (modern, typically electrical, but not always)

name: bass violon
description: Most common violin member today, it was the bass-range violin in the original consort.

name: bass violoncello
description: Sixteenth century predecessor of the violoncello, it was fretless with f-holes and had at first three, then later four, strings tuned in fifths.

name: cello
description: also know as violoncello

name: cimbalom
description: European hammered dulcimer

name: electric fretless guitar
description: Electric guitar without frets.

name: electric sitar
description: an electric derivation of the sitar, it often features sympathetic strings and a more guitar shaped body.

name: five-string banjo
description: A five-string banjo is a banjo with five strings.

name: fretless bass
description: variety of bass guitars without frets

name: Irish harp / clàrsach
description: An Irish/Scottish harp.

name: ukeke
description: The ukeke is a Hawaiian musical bow made of koa wood, 16 to 24 inches long and about 1½ inches wide with two or three strings fastened through and around either end.

name: ukulele
description: The ukulele is a small guitar-like instrument commonly associated with Hawaiian music. It generally has four nylon or gut strings.

name: ütőgardon
description: The ütőgardon is a folk musical instrument played primarily in Transylvania. It is similar in appearance to a cello, but played percussively like a drum.

name: valiha
description: The valiha is a bamboo tube zither from Madagascar

name: vichitra veena
description: The vichitra veena is a plucked string instrument used in Hindustani music.

name: Vietnamese guitar
description: The Vietnamese guitar is similar to a normal guitar, but with scalloped fingerboard resulting in elevated frets similar to the đàn nguyệt.

name: vihuela
description: Spanish string instrument.

name: viola caipira
description: Brazilian música caipira guitar — Used in folk-music, It has ten steel strings in five courses.

name: viola d'amore
description: Baroque fretless similar to both viols and violins. — While it is fretless and played like the violins 'a la braccia', it has a flat back, c-holes and sloping shoulders like a viol.

name: viola da gamba
description: The Generic member of the viol family, use it for Viol credits, most viola da gamba credits are however the Bass Viol

name: violino piccolo
description: The violino piccolo is a stringed instrument of the baroque period. Most examples are similar to a child's size violin in size and are tuned a third or a fourth higher.

name: viololyra
description: cretan lyra / violin hybrid) — Inspired by the violin in 1920, Hellenic luthiers combined parts of the old Cretan lyra with the violin.

name: violoncello piccolo
description: The violoncello piccolo is a Baroque string instrument which is between the viola and cello in size and typically has five strings.

name: violone
description: Contra/double-bass member of the viol family — Violone, The largest/deepest member of the Viol family

name: virginal
description: The virginals is a smaller and simpler rectangular form of the harpsichord with only one string per note

name: afoxé
description: The afoxé is a Brazilian instrument typically consisting of a gourd wrapped in a beaded net.

name: akete
description: three-parts drumset (baandu, funde, and kete) commonly used in Burru and Nyabinghi musics.

name: alfaia
description: The alfaia is a Brazilian cylindrical drum.

name: baandu
description: larger bass drum also known as thunder or pope smasher, it has a double goat skin membrane and is hit with a padded mallet. Important in the Jamaican Burru music and Rastafari movement

name: balafon
description: Balafon, Malian 'gourd xylophone'

name: bangu
description: Widely used in folk music, opera and music ensembles, it can be round or cone-shaped with cow/pigskin nailed to the larger convex end which has a small hole (guxin).

name: cajón
description: Cajón, Peruvian box drum

name: chau gong
description: The chau gong is a large gong made of brass or bronze which is almost flat except for the rim.

name: chime bar
description: A chime bar is a percussion instrument consisting of a tuned metal bar similar to a glockenspiel bar which is mounted on a wooden resonator and played with a mallet.

name: clapper
description: Made of wood, bone or metal, this ancient instrument is the forerunner to many other struck idiophones

name: clapstick
description: Used by Australian Aboriginals to maintain rhythm in chants and traditionally to accompany didgeridoo. There are also Boomerang clapsticks.

name: cymbal
description: Various types of cymbal. Also called chũm chọe

name: drum set
description: Set of drums developed from the 1930's onward, it is used in Jazz, Swing, Rock and Pop music. It consists of snare drum, tom-toms, hi-hats, cymbals and bass drum.

name: foot percussion
description: Percussion performed with the feet, such as foot tapping and clogging.

name: glass harmonica
description: Taking the concept of musical glasses but mounting the incrementing bowls on a turnable spindle, it is played with damp fingers.

name: glass harp
description: Known in Persia as far back as the 14th century, it consists of glass containers, tuned by either being filled with water or later being of different sizes.

name: gong bass drum
description: A gong bass drum is a large single drumhead which resembles a gong.

name: marímbula
description: The marímbula is a plucked box musical instrument from the Caribbean.

name: membranophone
description: Any kind of instrument with membranes, usually variously sized drums.

name: shakers
description: Tube made of metal or bamboo, it is filled with seeds, pebbles or sand. Especially used in Latin American music, it is shaken rhythmically to produce sound.

name: shekere
description: The shekere is a shaker from West Africa consisting of a gourd with beads woven into a net which covers the gourd.

name: shime-daiko
description: The shime-daiko is a small Japanese drum with a short but wide body which has a higher pitch than a normal taiko.

name: slit drum
description: A slit drum is a hollow percussion instrument made of wood or bamboo with a slit at the top.

name: tom-tom
description: A tom-tom (or just tom) is a cylindrical drum with no snare, commonly found in a standard drum set.

name: analog synthesizer
description: using analogue circuits and techniques to produce sound electronically, the first types where created in the 1920's with thermionic valves and other electromechanical machineries.

name: bass synthesizer
description: A bass synthesizer is used to create sounds in the bass range.

name: EWI
description: EWI (an acronym for electric wind instrument) is the name of Akai's wind controller.

name: guitar synthesizer
description: A guitar synthesizer is any one of a number of systems that allow a guitar player to play synthesizer sound.

name: Guitaret
description: electric lamellophone — small white electric thumb piano with metal tines and an electromagnetic pickup.

name: keyboard
description: electronic or digital keyboard

name: laser harp
description: A laser harp is an electronic musical instrument consisting of several laser beams to be blocked, in analogy with the plucking of the strings of a harp, in order to produce sounds.

name: Otamatone
description: Toy synthesizer — Shaped like an eighth-note with a cute face, it is played with one hand fingering the neck and the other squeezing the head to create wah-wah.

name: Pianet
description: electromechanical piano — An electromechanical piano (not to be confused with electronic piano) designed and produced by Hohner in the 1960 and 70s.

name: Reactable
description: The Reactable is an electronic musical instrument consisting of a round translucent table on which blocks are placed.

name: telharmonium
description: gigantic electronic organ transmitted through telephone wires — considered the first electromechanical musical instrument, an early electronic organ

name: tubon
description: analogue electronic monophonic Organ — electronic bass organ proto-keytar

name: effects
description: Effects refers to devices which enable a musician to modify the sound of an instrument.

name: gizmo
description: An effects device to be clamped on the bridge, it produces 'synthesizer-like' sounds

name: hydraulophone
description: woodwater - flute made with hydraulics) — Made of tubing with holes that may have everything from none to two reeds, water instead of air comes out of the holes.

name: other instruments
description: Other instruments. If you can't find an instrument, please request it.

name: talkbox
description: A talkbox is an effects device which enables a musician to modify the sound of an instrument.
